sentence.text: The thing that worried Nigel most about his son 's affairs was that they made him feel randy .
He says that I never feel randy these days , that I 'm ` cold " , and that the anorexia is stopping my hormones , which he says is stopping me from feeling sexy .
I still get randy when I think of that voluptuous female , as she was then .
Oriental history abounds with tales of randy eunuchs who enjoyed many a romp in the harem while the sultan 's back was turned .
I guessed they were a bit randy .
The unfortunate guy is Charles Dance , as a randy doctor who beds her and is whisked from the bed by the monster and chomped into little pieces .
( This may provoke wry smiles amongst anyone familiar with The Sunday People 's weekly diet of sex-op housewives and randy vicars . )
I 'd never say no , even if she was feeling a bit randy and I was n't .
I woke up before him feeling slightly randy but I knew there was nothing I could do about it .
The fire had at last begun to warm the room up a bit , and the brandy was warming him up inside , and Preston was suddenly feeling terribly , terribly randy .
She would rather be slobbered over by the randiest male than be touched in that way by her own sex .
I 'm still as randy as an adolescent
Messing around with all his money had made Sly feel powerful and randy .
Emily had been to La Scala to see Last Year In Marienbad with a randy theology student and had had a job shaking him off .
I gather randy old Ivor was screwing your missus .
Men Behaving Badly , back on Tuesday night , is about the antics of a randy football team .
Julian used to be a good-looking man somehow clouded , dispersed , by layers of fat and the radiation of pure thought ; now he is simply a cadaverous , eagly , extraordinarily randy man .
“ There was that randy English teacher … ”
